author: Tirpitz
content: The kotatsu's warmth seeps into my being... and now, I don't want to get out.

comments.content: First time? The kotatsu meme is not just a baseless anime trope~

replies.content: We must not fall for such temptations! Let us brave the cold outdoors – together!
If eating tangerines under the kotatsu is wrong, then I don't wanna be right~ Join the comf party, RJ~
My conviction is being tested... Will I persevere, or give in to sloth? To be continued...!

comments.content: That's how it gets you~ Once you slide your legs in, you won't ever want to leave.

replies.content: It seems not just the heart desires warmth, but also the body...

comments.content: The Queen of the North is dead! Long live the Queen of the Kotatsu!

replies.content: I will return to my frozen throne soon. Just... 5 more minutes...

comments.content: The kotatsu claims yet another victim!

replies.content: Indeed... But you know its warmth too, do you not, Commander? I take solace in that fact.

comments.content: Mmm, yummy tangerines.

replies.content: Ah, yes, the tangerines were excellent. Thank you for bringing them, Commander.

author: Belfast_inService
content: Osechi will be available today at the cafeteria.

comments.content: WHOA! I'll be there faster than you can say kamaboko!

replies.content: The Royal Maids, and Miss Hiei who gave us guidance, welcome you to partake in the feast.
All I did was offer a morsel of my experience. It is the Royal Maids who deserve all the praise.

comments.content: And might I ask what "osechi" is?

replies.content: A beautifully-assembled collection of traditional Sakura Empire foods eaten around New Year's.
Well, why didn't you just say so in the first place! I think I will give it a try!

comments.content: Exemplary work, Belfast! Show the world that no cuisine is too complex for our maids!

replies.content: You honour us, Your Majesty. We shall gladly prepare any dish you wish us to.

comments.content: Hey, leave some for me too!

replies.content: But of course, Master. We have already set aside a helping just for you.

author: Amagi
content: Has anyone yet to receive their New Year's gift?

comments.content: Thanks for the gift, Amagi! Most of it will go to Pooky's food budget, but hey.

replies.content: Be sure to treat Pooky to the best pet food you can find.

comments.content: Aren't these usually given to friends and family? Why'd I get one?

replies.content: Because you are like family to Akagi. That makes you like family to me.

comments.content: Can I get one too?

replies.content: But of course, Commander. You need only come and claim it at your leisure.

comments.content: Guess what? I have one for you!

replies.content: Oh, one for little old me? You're too kind, Commander~

author: HAI_110
content: I got a New Year shark from a nice Sakura Empire lady. Raaaawr!

comments.content: U-110 seemed to really like my shark-print envelope.

replies.content: it's so good! I'm gonna show it off to all my friends!

comments.content: Aww, ain't that cute? Wish I'd gotten one with an albacore print

replies.content: It so happens I have a little surprise for you. Come see me when you have time.
Wait, for realsies?! Whoa... I'm not used to being on the receiving end of surprises!
you could set up a commission system and make bank off of this.

comments.content: Are those great whites or tigers?

replies.content: they're shaaarks. guraaawr.

comments.content: I've also got a gift that'll make your jaws drop.

replies.content: you do? is it something sharky, or a swirly-whirly?

author: Pooky
content: Pooky and I wish you a happy New Year!

comments.content: Happy New Year, Suzutsuki! Soon spring will be upon us.

replies.content: Yup yup! It'll be warm again before long.

comments.content: I hope the next year will be... well, better. Of course, I'd always say that, but after this one especially...

replies.content: The darkest hour is just before the dawn! Don't worry.

comments.content: I'm still waiting for it to be year of the cat!

replies.content: good luck with that one lmao
I know there's no such thing, DUH! I'm just saying!

comments.content: Pooky sure is one cute furball of joy.

replies.content: Hehe! I like to think I am, too! Minus the fur.

comments.content: Happy New Year to you too!

replies.content: Thanks! Have a good one, Commander!

author: Mainz
content: First sunrise of the year. First water drawn. First cup of coffee brewn.

comments.content: What's so special about drawing water for the first time of the year?

replies.content: "Wakamizu" it's called. The first scoop of water of the year is meant to be holy, according to folklore.
Someone's cultured. Unlike Hipper, who spent New Year's Day sleeping in.
AND WHOSE FAULT IS THAT?! I was up all night, listening to your drunken rambling!

comments.content: I love the smell of fresh coffee in the morning.

replies.content: Couldn't agree more. Watching the sun rise, a cup of Pharisäer in hand... That's the dream.
I can do without the "waking up early to catch the sunrise" part, personally.
See ↑THIS↑, Eugen? And when *I* do it, it's wrong?!

comments.content: Early to bed, early to rise, huh?

replies.content: The early bird catches the worm, after all. Or in this case, the sunrise.

comments.content: Speaking of coffee, I need me a cup...

replies.content: Don't overwork yourself now, Commander. Enjoy the holidays for once.

author: Shinano
content: This one's New Year dream bodes well... for the year ahead of us...

comments.content: A mountain, an eagle, and an aubergine... I'd say it doesn't get much more auspicious than that!

replies.content: From this one, to all... may fortune smile upon you...

comments.content: I dreamt about an army of Pookies! Wonder what that symbolizes...

replies.content: I dreamt I turned into an army of San Diegos and graced everyone with my smarts!
Kasumi saw dozens upon dozens of Foos in the dream world...
Your dreams... they all seem so interesting to this one...

comments.content: And... what if you didn't have a dream? Like, at all? Is that a bad sign?

replies.content: Not at all... It bodes a year of peace and calm... You need not worry...
Whoa, really?! That's a load off my back! Thank you, Shinano!

comments.content: Happy (sleepy) New Year!

replies.content: Grateful is this one... May spring grace all of us shortly...

author: Zerstörer28
content: The Z-class all got together and we wrote down our New Year's wishes!

comments.content: When there's a million things you wish for, it ain't easy deciding on just one

replies.content: That's why you needed more time? Geesh.
One plaque for one wish just ain't enough for the one and only Lebe, y'know
You are just greedy. I suggest simply wishing for world peace.

comments.content: Only sheeple make wishes! The Fiend of the Crimson Darkness seizes what she desires with her own hands!

replies.content: So... you're a sheeple, then? You wrote down a wish too.
Indeed. I believe it went: "I wish to never have to do homework again."
The both of you, that is so rude! Peeping toms! Spies!

comments.content: I feel you, Lebe. It's not easy.

replies.content: It's tough, I tell you... Heard it's called "decision fatigue" when you get tired of trying to decide on one of many things

author: Biloxi
content: Bought this thing called an "omamori" while on a shrine visit.

comments.content: You're gonna have to explain what that means.

replies.content: It's basically a Sakura Empire amulet! Some promise good luck, others ward off evil spirits. I bought one for you too.
Oh really? That's cool, thanks!

comments.content: Got any for me~?

replies.content: Funny you ask, cause I do. I got you one that promises academic success.

comments.content: Question is: do they even do anything?

replies.content: Kinda! The more you believe in them, the more you subconsciously work toward the thing you want ^^
So it's a self-fulfilling prophecy kind of deal? Interesting...
I've got some for you gals too! These promise fortune, in both meanings of the word.

comments.content: Blue head to toe. You look great.

replies.content: Thanks! You're a real looker yourself, you know.

author: Chiyoda
content: Whew. It's been a hectic, but fulfilling day!

comments.content: Your hard work is greatly appreciated! Thank you for all your help.

replies.content: It was nuts... You serve one customer then two more queue up right after...
But hey, that's funding for the shrine's foreseeable future secured at least!

comments.content: Great work, nya! The gods will be very pleased with our sales report, nya!

replies.content: As will your investors, I'm sure.

comments.content: We would've been overwhelmed with visitors without Chiyoda's and Chitose's help!

replies.content: Just glad we could return the favor. You've helped us plenty before.
Akashi did compensate us too, so there's that... Hope it won't be so busy next time...

comments.content: Hats off to you for going above and beyond.

replies.content: Thanks! We're always happy to help at the shrine.
I got this close to passing out... Way, way too many people...

author: P.P.O
content: Mmm! I don't know what "shiruko" or "zouni" actually are, but boy do they smell delish!

comments.content: I can tell you one thing they have in common: they both have mochi in them!

replies.content: Really? Hmm... My stomach's only got room for one, so question is: which?
my suggestion: have one of them now, then save the other for dinner. how's that?
Ooh, that's a good idea! Très bien!

comments.content: I've heard of mochi. It's one of the Sakura Empire's confectionary staples, no?

replies.content: Your sweets sense is tingling, huh~? Will we see a Sakura Empire x Iris Libre cuisine crossover soon?
me, I'll just have the zouni as-is. I'm hungry.
Aha! I had a feeling you were more of a zouni person!

comments.content: Next time, we could have one each.

replies.content: As good an idea as any, Commander! Just watch out for New Year's excess.

comments.content: Can't have a Sakura Empire New Year without mochi.

replies.content: And heaps of it, too! You can add it to almost anything!

author: Tosa
content: Lucky Laugh is harder than one might think.

comments.content: The sillier it looks, the better! That's the point of the game :)

replies.content: I will admit, I did crack a smile upon seeing my own creation.

comments.content: meh, it's a good game and all but I know a better one: pin the tail on the akagi

replies.content: Oh, I know a better one yet: pin a dagger through the vermin's heart! Any volunteers~?
Let's try something a little less violent. Truth or dare might be your thing, Akagi.
Splendid idea! I will arrange a private truth or dare session with the Commander at once!

comments.content: Heh. You got pretty close, though.

replies.content: As did you. I never took you for one with such good intuition.

author: Haruna
content: Ugh... Feels like there's a maelstrom brewing in my stomach...

comments.content: Are you all right, dear? I warned you about eating too much.

replies.content: Well, what's done is done. Can't blame her for gorging herself on Hiei's next-level cooking.
Exactly... You blink and suddenly you've wolfed down 3 whole servings...

comments.content: Oh dear... I suggest eating some nanakusa-gayu to aid digestion. It is the season for it, after all.

replies.content: Thanks, Doc... I'll have some of that. This time, one serving only...

comments.content: Yeah I'm kinda feelin it too...

replies.content: Have you ever tried not inhaling your food, dumb dog?

comments.content: Gluttony might be a sin, but oh is this relatable.

replies.content: We're stomach pain buddies... Now let's both learn from our mistakes...

comments.content: Nanakusa-gayu? Tell me more.

replies.content: Ah, it's a type of rice porridge with 7 types of herbs, traditionally eaten around the 7th of January.

author: Kitakaze
content: I've been told these balls are not suited for playing dodgeball. Is this true?

comments.content: Well, no... Temari, as they're called, are probably not the best for playing dodgeball, or any ball game.

replies.content: You don't dribble or toss em around, you hold onto em for good luck! C'mon, you should know this!
I was today years old when I learned that temari truly are not suited for ball games.

comments.content: Do I look like I give a damn? No! I'll play fetch solo if I have to!

replies.content: What next, you gonna move into a doghouse and bark at stray cats?
HAH! You might think you're so smart but I'm way ahead of you!

comments.content: Just imagine how much effort goes into a temari.

replies.content: Maybe that is part of the reason why they shouldn't be thrown around.

comments.content: I'll put dodgeballs on the requisition list.

replies.content: You will? Superb! It would be great if you could join us for a match, Commander.

author: Grozny
content: The Sakura Empire's got sweet drinks for New Year's. Bottoms up.

comments.content: Do you mean \"sweet\" literally? Are you having amazake, by any chance?

replies.content: sounds like it! sure it's okay for her to drink that though?
It's got really low ABV so I wouldn't worry.

comments.content: Really low ABV? Well, I don't mean to be a stereotype, but... Heresy!

replies.content: Call me a heretic then but this stuff is GOOD.
Just don't have too much of it, all right?

comments.content: I'll drink to that.

replies.content: Way ahead of you, comrade Commander.

comments.content: Sounds a bit like rice porridge.

replies.content: Uh-huh, but in drinkable form. That's more my style.

author: Kii
content: Tossing dice puts me in the mood for some high-stakes cee-lo!

comments.content: Can we just NOT gamble and play Momopoly like normal people?

replies.content: Oh cmon Suruga! Don't be so low-energy!

comments.content: Cee-lo, you say? I have some time to kill. Why not.

replies.content: That's what I want to hear! Let's go babyyyy!
I didn't agree to this! You said we were going to play Momopoly!

comments.content: Kii's the dealer? All right, I'm in! Been ages since our last game

replies.content: Would you PLEASE read the comments? Momopoly! NOT cee-lo!

comments.content: A literal dice roll... I mean, sure.

replies.content: Feel like joining us, Commander? We'll wait for you.

comments.content: Did someone say Momopoly? I'm game!

replies.content: Thank you, Commander. At least YOU'RE in favor of sticking to the agreed-upon plan!

author: RAI
content: It's New Year's, you know what that means! Our annual game of Poetry against Humanity!

comments.content: Always fun to play! The eye strain from looking at the same cards all day, not so much, though...

replies.content: I had excellent cards, and I still came last! How?! Am I cursed with bad card luck?
Even the best cards are no good if added to a verse where they don't fit, Akatsuki.

comments.content: Poetry against Humanity? That's quite different from the card games I'm used to...

replies.content: Hanafuda, poker, and PaH ultimately boil down to one thing: it's all about how you play your cards!
A bit of an oversimplification... Though Souryuu is kind of better than me at card games across the board...

comments.content: DesDiv 6, all together in one place!

replies.content: As we always said we would be! We are bound by an eternal connection!

comments.content: Fill in: Akatsuki's ____ is her ____.

replies.content: Sense of direction, cause of genuflection.

author: L.I.
content: Actually, being kagami mochi is fine~

comments.content: I've heard of Long Island iced tea, but Long Island mochi's a new one...

replies.content: Just don't eat me, I'm only a spooky-slash-festive decoration~
my brain says no, but my stomach says yes (º﹃º)

comments.content: You shouldn't play with food. Or pretend to be food either.

replies.content: It's not the real thing, just a comfy cushion that looks like it~
Oh. Never mind, carry on then...
Where can I buy one for myself?

comments.content: Reckon it's bout time someone told ya what we do with kagami mochi...

replies.content: There's more to it than putting it up just as a decoration?
Yeah well... See, come jan 11th they've turned hecking hard, so then we take a big ol hammer n crack em open.
NOOOOO I DON'T WANNA BE MOCHI ANYMORE!

comments.content: Promise you won't destroy NY City with your puffiness.

replies.content: Don't worry, nobody would choose this as the form of their destructor~

author: Odin
content: Behold! Thor's hammer; the Mjölnir! I jest, of course. It is an ordinary hammer.

comments.content: What's it for? Some Sakura Empire tradition? If so, where do I sign up?

replies.content: As Shouhou explained to me, it is part of their custom called "kagamibiraki." It is for smashing mochi.
Why wouldn't a knife just cut it? No pun intended...
It's smashed to symbolize leaving the old year behind you. Cutting it into pieces wouldn't be the same thing.

comments.content: Now that's what I call a recipe for a smashing time! Can I bombard it too?

replies.content: I estimate a >75% probability that you're only joking, sister, but just in case: doing so would vaporize it.

comments.content: Don't do iiit! What has the poor mochi ever done to you?

replies.content: I'm sorry, little one. The deed is already done.
No amount of Sanity potions will help Long Island recover from that one...

comments.content: Mochi, what happened? Mochi?! MOCHIIIII!

replies.content: The mochi is inanimate, Commander. You are being silly.

comments.content: Bananas and mochi are both fated to be split, huh.

replies.content: As is tradition. Some things were never meant to be in one piece.

author: Izumo
content: Fire! It burns! IT BURNS!

comments.content: Who started a fire?! Someone get an extinguisher!

replies.content: There is no need to worry. This is just sagichou – a paper burning festival, part of our New Year traditions.
Oh, my apologies, then. I just assumed something was up, based on Izumo's reaction.
Sorry about that. My body just locks up when I see fire...

comments.content: Look at the intensity of those flames! The night is sure to be pleasantly warm.

replies.content: Let us not forget to collect the ashes and scatter them about the dorm later. Doing so is said to bring good health.

comments.content: So, the bonfire is lit...

replies.content: As long as it stays under control, it's all well and good...

comments.content: "Sagichou." It's got a nice ring to it.

replies.content: There are many theories as to the word's origin. Stop by and I'll tell you some of them, Commander!
